_meta.purpose: Ensure fair compensation and protection for all contributors through evidence-based economic governance
_meta.description: Economic and labor vocabulary extending DAHAO Core terms.

@labor_capacity.definition: The capacity to provide value through work, effort, skill, or resource contribution to a collective endeavor.

confidence_levels.HIGH: Verifiable on-chain or signed proof across multiple metrics

@exploitation.definition: A prolonged state of unfair value extraction where compensation does not match contribution, causing economic harm or deprivation.
@exploitation.note: Operational thresholds vary by context; uncertainty triggers @protection_ratchet

@fair_compensation.definition: The economic state where a contributor receives value proportional to their contribution, enabling sustainable participation.
components: Token compensation (GLITCH tokens via streaming payments or block rewards)
Voice in governance proportional to delegated stake
@fair_compensation.assessment: Measured through @exploitation indicators, @five_labor_rights compliance, and contribution metrics.

@value.definition: Measurable output or contribution that benefits the collective endeavor.
@value.measurement: Defined by domain-specific metrics and community consensus

@token.definition: Native token of the Glitch AppChain, used for value exchange, governance weight, and staking within the system.

properties.transferable: Can be exchanged between wallet addresses via x/bank MsgSend
properties.stakeable: Can be delegated to validators for governance weight via x/staking
properties.ibc_enabled: Can be transferred across IBC-connected chains
properties.non_dilutable: Per @protection_ratchet, earned tokens cannot be retroactively reduced

types: Contribution tokens (earned through work, distributed via x/distribution)

@inflation.definition: Dilution of token value through excessive issuance without corresponding value creation.
risk_indicators: Token supply growth exceeding value creation
@inflation.protection: Per @protection_ratchet, inflation cannot retroactively reduce earned value

@contribution_indicators.definition: Measurable markers indicating productive contribution to the system.

@five_labor_rights.definition: Five fundamental rights for all contributors in the system.

rights.name: freedom_from_wage_theft
rights.description: Fair and timely compensation for all work performed

rights.name: freedom_from_unsafe_conditions
rights.description: Healthy and safe work environment, physical or digital

rights.name: freedom_from_exploitation
rights.description: No forced labor, excessive hours, coercion, or value extraction without consent

rights.name: freedom_to_organize
rights.description: Right to collective bargaining, representation, and governance participation

rights.name: freedom_from_discrimination
rights.description: Equal treatment and opportunity regardless of background

@five_labor_rights.source: ILO Core Labor Standards and modern labor rights frameworks
@five_labor_rights.evolution_note: Rights may be extended but not reduced per @protection_asymmetry

@stakeholder_profile.definition: Comprehensive documentation of a stakeholder type's contribution evidence, compensation requirements, and protection status.

@practice.definition: An economic activity or policy that affects contributor welfare, subject to ethical assessment.

@economic_verdict.definition: Assessment of a practice's alignment with labor rights and fair compensation principles.

options.ETHICAL: Does not violate labor rights; acceptable practice
options.EXPLOITATIVE: Violates one or more labor rights; should be eliminated
options.COMPLEX: Mixed impacts; requires context and mitigation

@economic_verdict.note: Verdicts are operationalized via @rule_practice_evaluation. Use COMPLEX for mixed-impact cases with mitigation; reserve EXPLOITATIVE for elimination-presumptive cases.

@economic_impact.definition: Measurable effects of a practice on contributor welfare and compensation.
@economic_impact.evidence_required: Claims about economic impact require evidence per @evidence_based

@proof_of_useful_work.definition: Verifiable evidence that a contribution has been made, enabling fair reward allocation via Cosmos governance.

tier_A_on_chain.description: Cryptographically verifiable on Cosmos chain via transaction hash
tier_A_on_chain.verification: Query via RPC endpoint or block explorer

tier_A_signed.description: Digitally signed with wallet key and auditable
examples: Deliverable submissions (IPFS hash in tx memo)

tier_C.description: Self-reported with community attestation via governance vote

@proof_of_useful_work.reward_trigger: Valid proof triggers @reward_allocation via x/distribution or x/bank MsgSend

@economic_stability.definition: The system must maintain operational reserves and implement structural changes gradually to ensure sustainable contributor compensation and prevent systemic shocks that would harm all stakeholders.

reserve_requirement.description: Systems must maintain reserves sufficient to honor all pending compensation obligations

gradual_implementation.description: Structural economic changes should be phased with clear milestones
gradual_implementation.exception: Does not apply to adding protections per @protection_asymmetry

transparency.description: Reserve levels and transition timelines must be publicly visible

safeguards.no_payment_delays: Reserve requirements cannot be used to justify delayed compensation
safeguards.worker_voice: Stability measures affecting compensation require contributor input per @democratic_evolution
safeguards.protection_priority: Worker protections take precedence over stability concerns per @precautionary_default

@economic_stability.rationale: Economic instability harms all stakeholders. Reserves ensure payment capacity. Gradual transitions prevent chaos. These mechanisms support rather than undermine worker protection.

@gradual_transition.definition: Structural policy changes affecting compensation mechanisms, governance procedures, or system economics should be phased over appropriate periods with clear milestones, preventing systemic shocks while maintaining the absolute primacy of worker protections.

implementation_requirements.minimum_notice: 30 days advance notice for significant changes
implementation_requirements.impact_assessment: Changes must include analysis of effects on all stakeholder groups
implementation_requirements.contributor_voice: Affected contributors must have input opportunity per @democratic_evolution

safeguards.no_protection_delays: This term cannot be invoked to delay protections or remediation of active harm
safeguards.emergency_override: Documented ongoing harm triggers immediate response regardless of transition schedules
safeguards.precautionary_alignment: When transition timing is uncertain, favor faster implementation of protections per @precautionary_default

@gradual_transition.rationale: Abrupt structural changes can destabilize systems and harm all stakeholders through unintended consequences. Phased transitions allow for course correction and stakeholder adaptation. However, this principle exists to serve stability, not to obstruct justice - hence the explicit exemption for protective measures.

@balanced_stakeholders.definition: All parties (workers, platforms, validators, token holders) must have proportional representation in governance. No single group should dominate.
@balanced_stakeholders.rationale: Sustainable systems require buy-in from all participants.

@dispute_resolution.definition: A structured process for resolving conflicts through evidence-based mediation before escalation, incorporating asymmetric protections for vulnerable parties.

immediate.description: Upon dispute filing, interim protections activated for potentially harmed party

mediation.description: Both parties present evidence to neutral mediator(s); good faith participation required

escalation.description: Unresolved disputes proceed to community governance vote
escalation.trigger: Mediation failure OR ongoing harm OR party request with cause

principles.procedural_fairness: All parties may present evidence and respond
principles.substantive_protection: Uncertainty resolved per @precautionary_default favoring potentially harmed party
principles.no_retaliation: Filing disputes cannot trigger adverse action

@timely_compensation.definition: Compensation must be delivered within defined timeframes following verified work completion, with delays triggering graduated protective responses.

tier_A_on_chain.rationale: Cryptographically verified work requires no additional review time

tier_A_signed.rationale: Signed deliverables need minimal verification overhead

tier_C.rationale: Governance vote verification requires quorum assembly

graduated_response.notification: At 50% of maximum time, automatic notification to payer
graduated_response.grace_period: 24-hour grace period after maximum with documented reason required
graduated_response.escalation: After grace period, triggers @protection mechanisms and dispute flag

@timely_compensation.rationale: Delayed compensation constitutes value extraction per @exploitation indicators. Tiered timelines balance verification complexity with worker protection.

@burden_of_proof_in_disputes.definition: In disputes concerning compensation, labor rights, or exploitation claims, the party with greater institutional power and access to records bears the primary burden of demonstrating compliance with established standards. This creates a rebuttable presumption favoring the potentially harmed party when evidence is ambiguous or inaccessible.

mechanism.initial_burden: Claimant must present prima facie evidence of harm or violation
mechanism.burden_shift: Upon prima facie showing, institutional party must demonstrate compliance with relevant standards (@timely_compensation, @exploitation indicators, etc.)
mechanism.rebuttal: Presumption may be rebutted through verified evidence per @proof_of_useful_work tiers
mechanism.ambiguity_resolution: Unresolved ambiguity favors the party with less institutional power, per @precautionary_default

safeguards.good_faith_requirement: Claims must be made in good faith per @good_faith; frivolous claims may be dismissed
safeguards.proportionality: Burden weight scales with institutional asymmetry per @proportionality
safeguards.record_keeping: Parties are expected to maintain records proportional to their institutional capacity

@burden_of_proof_in_disputes.rationale: Institutional parties typically control documentation, systems, and records. Requiring vulnerable parties to prove negatives creates barriers to justice. This term operationalizes @precautionary_default in dispute contexts while maintaining fairness through rebuttal mechanisms.

@accessible_claims_process.definition: The compensation claims process must be navigable by all contributors regardless of technical sophistication, while maintaining verification integrity through existing @proof_of_useful_work tiers.

accessibility_requirements.time_to_initiate: Claim initiation must be achievable within 10 minutes for any contributor
accessibility_requirements.literacy_level: Required reading level must not exceed platform terms of service complexity
accessibility_requirements.modality_alternatives: Non-text options (voice, visual guides) must be available for core claim actions
accessibility_requirements.language_support: Claims must be submittable in any language with community translation assistance

community_advocates.description: Trained community members who assist contributors in navigating claims
community_advocates.requirements: Must have demonstrated good faith history per @good_faith

template_library.description: Pre-approved claim templates for common scenarios
template_library.verification: Templates designed to satisfy Tier C requirements of @proof_of_useful_work

integrity_safeguards.good_faith_requirement: All claims subject to @good_faith; frivolous claims trigger review
integrity_safeguards.graduated_trust: First-time assisted claims receive standard verification; expedited processing available after track record established

sustainability.funding_proportionality: Assistance services scaled to system reserves per @economic_stability
sustainability.capacity_triggers: Clear metrics for scaling assistance capacity based on demand and resources

@accessible_claims_process.rationale: Technical barriers to claims processes can function as de facto denial of compensation rights. This term operationalizes @individual_consideration by ensuring each contributor can access the system, while maintaining verification integrity and economic sustainability.
